page.title: 14GEOLOGY OF THE AREA
page.content:
The Geology of the area is entirely part of the Jurrasis succerssion, 190 to 130 million years old. Noted in other area for its links with the DINOSAURS. No local dinosaurs have been found in the immediate area but nevertheless geologist around the area can collect a wide variety of fossile. Brachiopods, (Terebratula, and Rhynconella) are common. Corals abound in certain bands. Ammonites are zone fossils and Belemnites frequently occur. There can be some disappointments however... some strata contain no immediately obsevable fossils.
The oolite series is made of closely packed grains of calcium and is named from its resemblance to fish roe. Other rocks contain calcite crystals and stalactitic materials. Like many
